intro: Ixora singalang, commonly known as the flame of the forest, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in dense clusters, creating a striking visual display. The plant is evergreen, with glossy, dark green leaves that provide a lush backdrop to its showy blooms. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Ixora singalang is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and as a hedge due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
